conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the forces acting on object A and determine the height it rises and the stiffness coefficient k2 of the light spring C.
Object A is at rest, spring B is horizontal and not deformed, the right endpoint of spring C is at position a, and the light rope on the upper end of A is just vertically straight.
The gravitational force of object A is mg = 2 × 9.8 × 0.6 = 11.6 N.
The tension force in the rope on the upper end of A is T = mg = 11.6 N.
The tension force in the spring B is TB = mg = 11.6 N.
The tension force in the spring C is TC = mg = 11.6 N.
The tension force in the spring C is TC = mg = 11.6 N (repeated).
